column4: I'm trying to install libapache2-mod-wsgi on ubuntu server but ubuntu try to install python 3 while we are using python 2.6 yet.... exist a way to force python dependecy to be 2.6.x?
doesn't exist some conf that force to ignore python >= 2.7?
I'm on maverick, and mine doesn't have that, it is python >= 2.6
I imagine that you could use pinning to force what you want, but... I think it is worth trying to figure out why your install is the way it is
I have no idea...I'm using a default install of last ubuntu server 10.10
what does apt-cache policy libapache2-mod-wsgi say?
hm, ChogyDan here is ubuntu version, what happen whe I try to install mod-wsgi and apt-cache policy: http://dpaste.de/OWgW/
I'm a Gentoo guy, have no idea of details in ubutu stuff
when I do a apt-cache showpkg it says that py 2.6 is in deps
oh!, I think it is the libpython3.1 dependency
I'll do the workaround related in bug
